title: This cockroach 'smoking' a cigarette is the internet's latest obsession
text:
CLOSE

A New York City cockroach is an entirely different species: One man caught a cockroach in Manhattan holding a cigarette.

Thomas Kretchmar, a New York-based divorce attorney, caught the roach dragging a cigarette through a sewer grate, at risk of falling through the cracks, or worse yet, dropping its dose of nicotine into the sewer. He tweeted the video, which now has over 21,000 retweets and 95,000 favorites.

Kretchmar later tweeted that he spotted the roach at the Fifth Avenue/53rd Street station in Manhattan. He did not immediately respond to a request for comment from USA TODAY.

"Cigarette cockroach" is the latest in a string of New York City creatures caught sneaking in a very-human vice, following "pizza rat" — the rodent caught carrying a slice of pepperoni pizza on its back down a flight of New York City subway stairs.

Tired: pizza rat

Wired: cigarette cockroach pic.twitter.com/HPxBLkWstX — Tom Kretchmar (@tkretchmar) October 18, 2019

This roach inspired a response unlike the average big-city roach.

"Cigarette Cockroach might just be the hero we deserve," tweeted comedian Hal Rudnick.

Another joked: "Cigarette roach for mayor of nyc."

Others were less than impressed with the smoking roach.

"Every girl know someone who dated a cigarette cockroach," tweeted one user.

One person did not forget the negative effects of smoking, despite the internet's adoration for this roach: "Here’s hoping the #cigarette roach gets lung cancer."
